description.p: You become adept at using your dexterity to navigate tricky obstacles. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in Acrobatics. If you’re already proficient in it, you gain expertise with it, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.
As a bonus action, you can make a DC 15 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. If you succeed, difficult terrain doesn’t cost you extra movement until the end of your turn.

sheet.description: You can make a DC 15 Acrobatics check. If you succeed, difficult terrain doesn’t cost you extra movement until the end of your turn.

description.p: You have studied the secrets of alchemy and are an expert in its practice, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain proficiency with alchemist’s supplies. If you’re already proficient with them, you gain expertise with them, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.
You automatically succeed on checks made to identify potions using your alchemist’s supplies.

With 8 hours of work, you can improve the potency of one potion of healing of any rarity. To use this benefit, you must have alchemist’s supplies with you, and the potion must be within reach. The creature drinking the potion can forgo the potion’s die roll and regains the maximum number of hitpoints that the potion can restore.

description.p: You become proficient with Alchemist’s Supplies.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Alchemist’s Supplies.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Alchemist’s Supplies.

description.p: You have dabbled in magic and studied the arcane arts, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in the Arcana skill. If you’re already proficient in it, you gain expertise with it, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.
You learn the prestidigitation and detect magic spells. You can cast detect magic once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast detect magic once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

description.p: You are a creative, learning a variety of artistic crafts. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence or Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency with two artisan’s tools of your choice. You gain expertise with them, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with your two Artisan chosen tools.

description.p: Bows are used by many, but you have trained to make the most of them. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: When you use the Attack action with a shortbow on your turn, you can make one additional ranged weapon attack as a bonus action.
When you use a longbow, its damage die increases from a d8 to a d10.
You can use Strength instead of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls you make with longbows.

sheet.description: When you use the Attack action with a shortbow on your turn, you can make one additional ranged weapon attack as a bonus action. When you use a longbow, its damage die increases from a d8 to a d10. You can use Strength instead of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls you make with longbows.

description.p: You have broken many locks, and their mechanisms and designs are familiar to you. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency with thieves’ tools. If you are already proficient with them, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with them.
You automatically succeed on checks made to identify the complexity and difficulty of locks using your thieves tools.

sheet.description: You automatically succeed on checks made to identify the complexity and difficulty of locks using your thieves tools.

description.p: You become proficient with Thieves’ Tools.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Thieves’ Tools.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Thieves’ Tools.

description.p: You have studied in the methods and techniques of mapmaking. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain proficiency with cartographer’s and navigator’s tools. If you’re already proficient with either of these tools, you gain expertise with that tool, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.
You can easily and accurately understand any map, even those written in a language you can’t read.
Even when you are drawing a map while traveling, you remain alert to danger.

Maps that you draw can be easily understood by any creature that shares a language with you, and a creature possessing such a map can’t become lost within the area the map displays if it can understand it. You must have cartographer’s tools to use this benefit.

sheet.description: You can easily and accurately understand any map, even those written in a language you can’t read. Even when you are drawing a map while traveling, you remain alert to danger. Maps that you draw can be easily understood by any creature that shares a language with you, and a creature possessing such a map can’t become lost within the area the map displays if it can understand it. You must have cartographer’s tools to use this benefit.

description.p: You become proficient with Cartographer’s Tools.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Cartographer’s Tools.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Cartographer’s Tools.

description.p: You become proficient with Navigator’s Tools.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Navigator’s Tools.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Navigator’s Tools.

description.p: Fighting for an audience is your forte, and you maximize the use of more exotic weapons to show off your prowess. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in Performance. If you’re already proficient in it, you gain expertise with it, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.

You gain proficiency with nets, and when you use the Attack action and attack with a net, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one-handed weapon you are holding. Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your attack rolls with a net, and the escape DC for your nets increases by your proficiency bonus.
You gain proficiency with tridents, and you can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a trident.

sheet.description: When you use the Attack action and attack with a net, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one-handed weapon you are holding. Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your attack rolls with a net, and the escape DC for your nets increases by your proficiency bonus. You can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a trident.

description.p: You have mastered a variety of special recipes, allowing you to prepare fine meals that can satiate a whole party. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Dexterity, Constitution, or Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain proficiency with cook’s utensils. If you’re already proficient with them, you gain expertise with them, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.
You automatically succeed on checks made to determine whether food or drink is poisoned.

As part of a short rest, you can prepare and serve a meal that helps you and your allies recover from the rigors of adventuring, provided you have suitable food worth at least 5gp, cook’s utensils, and other supplies on hand. The meal serves up to six people, and each person who eats it regains two additional Hit Dice at the end of the short rest. In addition, those who partake of the meal have advantage on Constitution saving throws against disease for the next 24 hours.

sheet.description: You automatically succeed on checks made to determine whether food or drink is poisoned. The meal serves up to six people, and each person who eats it regains two additional Hit Dice at the end of the short rest. In addition, those who partake of the meal have advantage on Constitution saving throws against disease for the next 24 hours.

description.p: You become proficient with Cook’s Utensils.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Cook’s Utensils.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Cook’s Utensils.

description.p: You are adept at harnessing the useful properties of herbs and other plants. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency with herbalism kits. If you’re already proficient with them, you gain expertise with them, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.
You automatically succeed on checks made to determine whether plants are edible or poisonous using your herbalism kit.

You can apply herbal remedies to help yourself or your allies recover from maladies. With 8 hours of work, you can remove one poison or disease from a friendly creature within reach. You must have an herbalism kit and either a component pouch or access to local herbs to use this benefit.

sheet.description: You automatically succeed on checks made to determine whether plants are edible or poisonous using your herbalism kit. You can apply herbal remedies to help yourself or your allies recover from maladies. With 8 hours of work, you can remove one poison or disease from a friendly creature within reach. You must have an herbalism kit and either a component pouch or access to local herbs to use this benefit.

description.p: You become proficient with the Herbalism Kit.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Herbalism Kit.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with your Herbalism Kit.

description.p: You have an eye for detail and can pick out the smallest clues. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in the Investigation skill. If you’re already proficient in it, you gain expertise with it, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.
You can take the Search action as a bonus action.

sheet.description: You can take the Search action as a bonus action.

description.p: Prerequisites: Strength or Dexterity 13 or higher

You have trained in a certain specialized technique of fighting. You gain the benefits of a fighting style of your choice, as per the Fighter’s Fighting Style feature. (Page 72 of the Player’s Handbook)
description.ul: You can select this feat multiple times. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose multiple.

description.p: You have honed your ability to shape your personality and to read the personalities of others. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain proficiency with the disguise kit. If you’re already proficient with them, you gain expertise with them, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.

If you spend 1 hour observing a creature, you can then spend 8 hours crafting a disguise you can quickly don to mimic that creature. Making the disguise requires a disguise kit. You must make checks as normal to disguise yourself, but you can assume the disguise as an action.

sheet.description: If you spend 1 hour observing a creature, you can then spend 8 hours crafting a disguise you can quickly don to mimic that creature. Making the disguise requires a disguise kit. You must make checks as normal to disguise yourself, but you can assume the disguise as an action.

description.p: You become proficient with the Disguise Kit.

element.name: Master of Disguise (Disguise Kit Double Proficiency)

description.p: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Disguise Kit.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with your Disguise Kit.

description.p: Your extensive study of nature and its mystic workings grants you the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in Nature. If you’re already proficient in it, you gain expertise with it, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.

You learn the druidcraft and detect poison and disease spells. You can cast detect poison and disease once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast detect poison and disease once without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You have studied the application of poisons and toxins, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain proficiency with poisoner’s kits. If you’re already proficient with them, you gain expertise with them, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.
You automatically succeed on checks made to identify poisons using your poisoner’s kit.

With 8 hours of work, you can improve the potency of one dose of poison. To use this benefit, you must have a poisoner’s kit, and the poison must be within reach. The DC to resist the poison becomes 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier, unless it was already higher, and it deals extra poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier, if it deals damage to the target.

sheet.description: You automatically succeed on checks made to identify poisons using your poisoner’s kit. With 8 hours of work, you can improve the potency of one dose of poison. To use this benefit, you must have a poisoner’s kit, and the poison must be within reach. The DC to resist the poison becomes {{poisoner:save-dc}}, unless it was already higher, and it deals extra poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier, if it deals damage to the target.

description.p: You become proficient with the Poisoner’s Kit.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with Poisoner’s Kit.

sheet.description: Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any check you make with your Poisoner’s Kit.

description.p: You have mastered the covert application of blowguns and darts. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Your ranged attacks with blowguns use a d4 for damage.
When you are hidden from a creature and attack it with a blowgun or dart, making the attack doesn’t reveal your position.
You ignore the loading property of blowguns.

sheet.description: >Your ranged attacks with blowguns use a d4 for damage. When you are hidden from a creature and attack it with a blowgun or dart, making the attack doesn’t reveal your position. You ignore the loading property of blowguns.

description.p: You are an expert with the sling, capable of striking your foes with deadly precision. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When you use a sling, its damage die increases from a d4 to a d6.
You can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a sling.

sheet.description: When you use a sling, its damage die is a d6. You can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a sling.

description.p: Your extensive study of religion and cosmology grants you the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in Religion. If you’re already proficient in it, you gain expertise with it, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.

You learn the thaumaturgy and detect evil and good spells. You can cast detect evil and good once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast detect evil and good once without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You are an expert at the techniques of throwing weapons, and their application in combat. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Attacking at long range doesn’t impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls with thrown weapons.
When you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack with a thrown weapon, you have advantage on your next melee weapon attack against that creature before the end of your next turn.
You can engage in two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons you are wielding aren’t light, if at least one of them has the thrown property.

sheet.description: Attacking at long range doesn’t impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls with thrown weapons. When you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack with a thrown weapon, you have advantage on your next melee weapon attack against that creature before the end of your next turn. You can engage in two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons you are wielding aren’t light, if at least one of them has the thrown property.

description.p: You are skilled at traditional methods of hunting and trapping, gaining the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency in Survival. If you’re already proficient in it, you gain expertise with it, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.

You gain proficiency with nets, and when you use the Attack action and attack with a net, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one-handed weapon you are holding. Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your attack rolls with a net, and the escape DC for your nets increases by your proficiency bonus.
The escape DC of traps that you place, such as hunting traps (Page 152 of the Player’s Handbook), increases by your proficiency bonus.

sheet.description: When you use the Attack action and attack with a net, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one-handed weapon you are holding. Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn’t impose disadvantage on your attack rolls with a net, and the escape DC for your nets increases by your proficiency bonus. The escape DC of traps that you place increases by {{proficiency}}.

description.p: You have mastered the strange and difficult art of using a whip in combat. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When you use a whip, its damage die increases from a d4 to a d6.

Whenever you have advantage on a melee attack roll you make with a whip and hit, you can attempt to force the target to drop one item of your choice that it’s holding. The target must succed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your Proficiency bonus) or drop the object you choose. The object lands at its feet. The target has advantage on the saving throw if it’s holding the item with two or more hands.
